--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> =
wrote:
>
> Hello Karthik,
> 
> That's not necessarily simple. How do you ma=
ke html into plain text? 
> There is software that does that, including jav=
a libraries (see 
> discussion here 
> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2=
40546/removing-html-from-a-java-string). 
> One thing you could do is code =
a custom writer that uses one of these 
> libraries. Then a question is, wh=
ere does it write? It could still write 
> to a warc, but if you do that yo=
u'll want to be careful that what you 
> write conforms to the warc spec. I=
f not warc, then you will have to come 
> up with some other system, which =
may not be trivial.
> 
> It might make more sense to convert to plain text =
outside of heritrix, 
> by running some postprocessing on the warcs, althou=
gh that probably also 
> will not be trivial.
> 
> Noah
>
